alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 4:40PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin County through 515 PM CST... At 440 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Weston, or 10 miles south of Red Bay, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville, Belgreen, Vina, Hodges, Atwood, Isbell, Duketon, Spruce Pine, Rockwood and Little Bear Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northwestern Alabama.
